greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The length of a longest path from n to a power of 2, when applying the nondeterministic maps k -> k - k/p and  k -> k + k/p, where p can be any of the odd prime factors of k, and the maps can be applied in any order.
comment: The length of a longest path from n to a power of 2, when using the transitions x -> A171462(x) and x -> A335876(x).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
formula: Fully additive with a(2) = 0, and a(p) = 1+max(a(p-1), a(p+1)), for odd primes p.
program: A335884(n) = if(A209229(n),0,my(xs=Set([n]),newxs,a,b,u); for(k=1,oo, newxs=Set([]); if(!#xs, return(k-1)); for(i=1,#xs,u = xs[i]; a = A171462(u); if(!A209229(a), newxs = setunion([a],newxs)); b = A335876(u); if(!A209229(b), newxs = setunion([b],newxs))); xs = newxs));
xref: Cf. A335883 (position of the first occurrence of each n).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 29 2020
